revisions.rev:
{{Main|Commemorative coins of Poland}} Poland has a rich selection of [[Gold]] and [[Silver]] commemorative coins. In the year 2005 coins were launched in the series: "Polish Kings and Princes", "Animals of the World", "History of the Polish Zloty" and "Polish Painters of the Turn of 19th and 20th Centuries" and various occasional coins.{{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/Homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2005.html | title=Collector coins and 2 zÅ Nordic Gold coins issued by the NBP in 2005 | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-04-16}} {|class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| [[MikoÅaj Rej]] (1505â1569) - 500th Anniversary of the Birth (Gold){{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2005/Rej_en.pdf | title=MikoÅaj Rej (1505-1569) - 500th Anniversary of the Birth coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-03-16}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Olszewska-Borys | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 200 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Au 900/1000 (Gold) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 3,600 pcs{{cite journal |title=Cennik monet kolekcjonerskich | journal=PrzeglÄd Numizmatyczny |publisher=Stowarzyszenie NumizmatykÃ³w Polskich - Polish Numismatic Society|volume=63/2008 |issue=4 |pages=23â26 |year=2008 |issn=1231-143X |oclc=68734851 }} | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 20 January 2005 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|27.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|15.50|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 1.900 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: Stylised goose quill pen located diagonally in the centre. Image of the Eagle, established as the state Emblem of the Republic of Poland, and the circumscription, RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA and notation of the year of issue, 2005, above and left. Inscription, 200/ ZÅ, on the right-hand side. Facsimile of MikoÅaj Rej's signature, below. The Mint's mark, m/w , under the Eagle's left leg. Reverse: Bust of MikoÅaj Rej with fragments of architecture in the background. Circumscription: 1505 on the left, 1569 on the right. Inscription: 500. ROCZNICA/ URODZIN/ MIKOÅAJA/REJA underneath the bust. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| [[MikoÅaj Rej]] (1505â1569) - 500th Anniversary of the Birth (Silver) |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Olszewska-Borys | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 60,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 20 January 2005 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|32.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|14.14|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 60 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: In an oval: an image of the Eagle, established as the state Emblem of the Republic of Poland and an inscription: 10, underneath the Eagle. Inscription in the rim: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA, and notation of the year of issue: 2005, preceded and followed by a dot, and an inscription: ZÅOTYCH. The Mint's mark, m/w, under the Eagle's left leg. Reverse: Portrait of MikoÅaj Rej in an oval. Inscription surrounding the portrait: 500. ROCZNICA URODZIN MIKOÅAJA REJA 1505-1569, separated by dots. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| ''Polish Kings and Princes:'' [[August II the Strong]] (1697â1706, 1709â1733){{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2005/mocny_en.pdf | title=The August II the Strong coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland | accessdate=2009-06-17}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 100 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Au 900/1000 (Gold) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 4,200 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 22 February 2005 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|21.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|8.00|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 2.000zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: Image of the Eagle, established as the state Emblem of the Republic of Poland. Notation of the year of issue, 20-05, on the Eagle's sides. Inscription: ZÅ 100 ZÅ, below the Eagle. Inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA, in the rim. The Mint's mark, m/w, under the Eagle's left leg. Reverse: Bust of the King August II Mocny. Inscription in the rim, AUGUST II MOCNY, above; 1697-1706 1709-1733, below. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| ''Polish Kings and Princes:'' [[August II the Strong]] (1697â1706, 1709â1733) |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 61,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 22 February 2005 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|32.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|14.14|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 60zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: Image of the Eagle, established as the state Emblem of the Republic of Poland. Notation of the year of issue, 20-05, on the Eagle's sides. Inscription: ZÅ 10 ZÅ, below the Eagle. Inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA, in the rim, preceded and followed with five pearls. The Mint's mark, m/w, under the Eagle's left leg. Reverse: Half-figure of King August II Mocny. Inscription in a semicircle, AUGUST II MOCNY, on the left side; inscription in a semicircle, 1697-1706 1709-1733, on the right side. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| ''Animals of the World:'' [[Eagle Owl]] (Bubo bubo) {{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2005/puchacz_en.pdf | title=Eagle Owl coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland | accessdate=2009-06-17}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Obverse designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska
'''Reverse designer:''' Andrzej Nowakowski | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 20 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 61,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 15 March 2005 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|38.61|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|28.28|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 350zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: Image of the Eagle, established as the state Emblem of the Republic of Poland. Notation of the year of issue: 20-05, and inscription: ZÅ 20 ZÅ, below the Eagle. Images of the national flag by the sides of Eagle's legs. At the top inscription in a semicircle: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA. The Mint's mark, m/w,under the Eagle's left leg. Reverse: Images of an adult eagle owl and three [[nestling]] in a nest in a [[pine]] tree. At the top inscription in a semicircle, PUCHACZ - Bubo bubo. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| An International Exhibition [[Expo 2005|EXPO 2005]] Japan (Gold) {{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2005/expo_en.pdf | title=EXPO 2005 coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland | accessdate=2010-06-06}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Robert Kotowicz | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zl 200 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Au 900/1000 (Gold) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 4,200 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 23 March 2005 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|27.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|15.50|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: A stylised view of a fragment of the monument to [[Fryderyk Chopin]] from the Royal Åazienki Park in Warsaw. Below, on the left-hand side, an image of the Eagle, established as the state Emblem of the Republic of Poland. Above the Eagle, on the left-hand side, an inscription: 200 ZÅ. On the left-hand side, circumscribed, the notation of the year of issue: 2005. Below, a circumscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA. The Mint's mark, m/w , under the Eagle's left leg. Reverse: Stylised views of the Nagoya Castle with the [[Mount Fuji|Fuji Mountain]] in the background and of a branch of a blossoming plum-tree. Above, an inscription: EXPO / 2005 / AICHI. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| An International Exhibition [[Expo 2005|EXPO 2005]] Japan (Silver) |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Robert Kotowicz | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zl 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 80,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 23 March 2005 | align=left | '''Length:''' {{convert|43.40|mm|in|2|abbr=on}}

An image of the Eagle, established as the state Emblem of the Republic of Poland, on the left-hand side, and an inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA along the left edge. Notation of the year of issue: 2005 and an inscription: 10 ZÅ along the right edge. The Mint's mark, m/w , under the Eagle's left leg. Reverse: A view of a pair of cranes. An inscription: 2005 AICHI along the right edge of the coin. |- | colspan="4" |   |} ==See also== * [[Numismatics]] * [[Regular issue coinage]] * [[Coin grading]] ==References== {{Reflist|2}} {{Polish currency and coinage}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2010}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Commemorative Coins Of Poland: 2005}} [[Category:Commemorative coins of Poland]]
